DataElement.preferredName: Hypoxia Requirement Minimum Fraction of Inspired Oxygen Symptom Present Begin Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day, and year hypoxia requiring minimal supplemental oxygen began.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hypoxia Requirement Minimum Fraction of Inspired Oxygen Symptom Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the amount of oxygen in the body. Symptoms range from mild (impaired judgment, memory loss, impaired motor coordination) to severe (seizures and coma)._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._The smallest possible quantity._The molar fraction of oxygen in an inhaled gas._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).
